title: CyberArk EPM Overview
description: This dashboard provides a unified view of CyberArk EPM activity, combining raw audit events, policy events, and administrative audit events.

definition.content:
[CyberArk Endpoint Privilege Manager](https://www.cyberark.com/products/endpoint-privilege-manager/) enforces least privilege and enables organizations to block and contain attacks on endpoint computers, reducing the risk of information being stolen or encrypted and held for ransom.

This dashboard provides a unified view of CyberArk EPM activity, combining raw audit events, policy events, and administrative audit events.

For more information, see the [CyberArk Endpoint Privilege Manager Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/cyberark_endpoint_privilege_manager/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the upper-right corner of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify, and add widgets and visualizations.
This group enables monitoring of trends over time, identification of top users and source IPs, analysis by service, and detailed event investigation to support security oversight and compliance.

definition.title: Set admin audit events over time
Account admin audit events over time

search.query: source:cyberark-endpoint-privilege-manager service:(raw-events OR policy-audit-events OR set-admin-audit-events OR account-admin-audit-events) $service $user_name $client_ip

definition.content: Datadog Cloud SIEM analyzes and correlates the CyberArk EPM logs to detect threats to your environment in real time. If you don't see signals please make sure you've enabled [Datadog Cloud SIEM](/security).
